intro: Carum multiflorum subsp. strictum, commonly known as narrowleaf caraway, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and dill. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems and small, compound umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. The fruit, which is a small, dry schizocarp, contains the aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and cuisine.
